column4: so you anticipate this command opening up a port on the remote server to which you can connect to from your local machine and have your traffic forwarded to wherever
right?
a sql server that is running locally, yes?
n00b, are you using the tor browser bundle
i need to keep straight what we are calling local and what we are calling remote. the sql server is running on the network which is local relative to the machine initiating the ssh connection, yes?
n00b, vidalia should have an option to specify a proxy, does it not?
n00b, are you sure the port, etc. is correct? what information does it ask for aside from host and port
n00b, you do not need or want a bridge unless your isp or country blocks tor traffic
n00b, if you ust have a regular proxy, that is not the same thing as a tor bridge
bridges are for people in places like iran, syria, etc.
yeah!
but he may want to help them ;>
i think tor works in syria, and i think at least bridges work in iran
they ahve in the past, but i dont think they do presently.
nice then D;
i ran myself at the time just for help D;
nice :)

yeah
he is already gone. i think he don't understand the concept of exit node or a bridge / relay
